sentences: Nguyễn Thanh Tùng (born 5 July 1994), known professionally as Sơn Tùng M-TP ([s̪əːn˧ tuŋ˨˩ ɛm˧ te˧ pe˧]), is a Vietnamese singer-songwriter and actor.
section: N/A

sentences: Born and raised in Thái Bình City, Thái Bình Province, his family discovered his singing ability when he was two years old.
section: N/A

sentences: His self-written 2012 and 2013 singles, "Cơn mưa ngang qua" and "Em của ngày hôm qua" launched his career.
section: N/A

sentences: These were followed by successful singles such as "Chắc ai đó sẽ về", "Lạc trôi" and "Nơi này có anh".
section: N/A

sentences: In 2017, Tùng released the compilation album m-tp M-TP and published his autobiography, Chạm tới giấc mơ.
section: N/A

sentences: Tùng spent four years as part of Văn Production and WePro Entertainment until his record label, M-TP Entertainment, was founded in late 2016.
section: N/A

sentences: His other works include the M-TP Ambition - Chuyến bay đầu tiên concert tour (2015–2016), a starring role in the 2014 film Dandelion (which earned him a Golden Kite Prize for Young Prominent Actor) and an appearance as a contestant on the television series The Remix.
section: N/A

sentences: Called a "Prince of V-pop" for his popularity, Tùng has received many accolades which include a MTV Europe Music Award, a Dedication Music Award, a Mnet Asian Music Award, seven Green Wave Awards and an inclusion on Forbes Vietnam's 2018 30 Under 30 list.

== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Tùng recalled in his autobiography Chạm tới giấc mơ that he frequently listened to his grandparents singing Quan họ (a Vietnamese folk music style originating in Bắc Ninh) as a child.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Its signature vocal style eventually affected his way of singing slur notes, and Vietnamese folk music in general has inspired his work.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: The singer later grew up listening to artists such as Quang Vinh, whom he idolized, Chris Brown, Rihanna and Justin Bieber.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Tùng has also been influenced by the Vietnamese underground hip hop scene and K-pop acts, including Big Bang, Super Junior and TVXQ.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: After the death of Thái Bình-born composer An Thuyên in 2015, he said that Thuyên was the biggest influence on his artistry, and expressed appreciation when the composer defended him during the controversy surrounding "Chắc ai đó sẽ về" in 2014.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: His early releases contain pop, contemporary R&B and hip-hop elements.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Tùng followed electronic dance music later in his career, with the tropical house-oriented "Chúng ta không thuộc về nhau" (2016) being one of his first releases in the genre.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Some of his productions also incorporated Vietnamese traditional musical instruments—most notably "Lạc trôi" (2017), which is a future bass track featuring the đàn tranh and sáo.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In a 2014 interview, Tùng said that most of his romantic lyrics were inspired by Korean dramas and his former high-school crush; the latter was most evident in the lyrics of "Em của ngày hôm qua" (2013).
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Many of his early songs referred to rain, and so he was nicknamed "the Rain Prince" by the early press.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: "Không phải dạng vừa đâu" and "Remember Me" were 2015 tracks Tùng wrote in response to the backlash against his career.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He performed them with his signature rap vocals, which over the years were often described as being unclear and divided public reception.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Also in addition to electronic keyboards, Tùng plays the piano.
section: == Artistry ==
== Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Public image and achievements
section: == Public image and achievements ==
== Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Tùng, known as one of the most successful Vietnamese artists, has been called the "Prince of V-pop".
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Forbes Vietnam and Thể thao & Văn hóa described the singer "a phenomenon of Vietnamese Pop".
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: According to Thể thao & Văn hóa's Cung Ly, Tùng's knack for "smoothly" blending originality with mainstream K-pop was the reason for his success.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: However, public reception during his early career was polarized.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Due to Tùng's past copyright issues, his work was frequently compared to other foreign songs.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Forbes Vietnam's contributor Phan T. Trang wrote that although the public has been more "generous and open" towards the singer since the releases of "Lạc trôi" and "Nơi này có anh", the industry still doubts his creativity.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: In 2015, the WeChoice Awards named Tùng one of its five Inspiration Ambassadors (the awards show's top honor).
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: It also voted him one of the ten most influential people in Vietnam in 2014 and 2017, and one of 2015's five most influential artists.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: In May 2016, U.S. President Barack Obama mentioned Tùng during a speech examining the impact of social media on young Vietnamese.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: The speech was part of Obama's town-hall meeting with members of the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative in Ho Chi Minh City.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: In 2018, Forbes Vietnam included Tùng in its annual 30 Under 30 list.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: He has also been included on the Green Wave Awards' top-five Favorite Singers (Top Hit board) list three consecutive times since 2015.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Tùng has been described as a fashion icon, despite his fashion and music being repeatedly compared to South Korean musician G-Dragon and members of Big Bang.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: In 2017, Vietnamese Elle gave him a Style Award for Most Stylish Male Singer.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: His fan base, Sky, has a large following in the country.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Tùng has endorsed a number of brands and companies, including Oppo, Yamaha and Jollibee.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Oppo launched the singer's phone line, Sơn Tùng M-TP Limited Edition F3, in June 2017.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: A pair of shoes from Biti's Hunter collection sold out after its product placement in the "Lạc trôi" music video.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Biti's recognized it as a factor in its 300-percent increase in sales, which helped revive the brand.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: In September 2016, Tùng's red-carpet interview at The Face Vietnam's first season finale went viral.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: It inspired memes, remixes, original songs performed by Hồ Ngọc Hà, Noo Phước Thịnh and Only C, and eventually received a WeChoice Award for Catchphrase of the Year.
section: == Public image and achievements ==

sentences: Only C's song, "Yêu là 'tha thu'", was on the soundtrack of the film
section: == Public image and achievements ==
